description: During the Requirements Analysis Phase, the business (project in-scope) requirements documented during the Concept Phase are validated and further analyzed and decomposed into functional and non-functional requirements that define the Business Product in more detail with regard to inputs, processes, outputs, and interfaces.
If appropriate, a logical depiction of the data entities, relationships and attributes of the system/application is created.
During this phase, the initial strategy for testing and implementation should be considered.
Work planned for future phases is redefined based on information acquired during this phase.
The phase ends with a review to determine readiness to proceed to the Design Phase.
Detailed application requirements are required to permit detailed project management planning, execution, and control.
If detailed requirements and subsequent planning identify a breach of cost, schedule, or performance baselines, a formal change request should be submitted.

responsibilities.Business Owner: Participates in the Requirements activities and may approve final requirements.
responsibilities.End Users: Participate in developing detailed functional requirements and provide input for non-functional requirements.
responsibilities.Project Manager: Responsible and accountable for the successful planning and execution of the Requirements Analysis Phase. Leads the Integrated Project Team to accomplish phase tasks and deliverables.
responsibilities.Integrated Project Team: Members are responsible for accomplishing assigned tasks as directed by the Project Manager.
responsibilities.Contracting Officer: Responsible for preparing solicitation documents under the guidance of the Project Manager.

Critical Partners.Enterprise Architecture: Ensure requirements provide a suitable basis for design activities, technologies align with Enterprise Architecture, and traceability matrices and data models are complete.
Critical Partners.Security: Ensure assessment of required security and privacy controls per FIPS-199/NIST, and that Accreditation Boundaries and relationships are established.
Critical Partners.Acquisition: Review acquisition strategy to ensure inclusion of requirements analysis, alternatives analysis, and procurement/contract award plans.
Critical Partners.Budget: Ascertain alignment with project-level cost baselines or request formal rebaseline if necessary.
Critical Partners.Finance: Determine compliance with financial management requirements and cost baselines.
Critical Partners.HR: Verify staffing and organizational requirements are fully documented.
Critical Partners.Section 508: Ensure accessibility standards have been identified.
Critical Partners.CPIC: Confirm Requirements Document includes traceability matrix, business process model, and logical data model.
Critical Partners.Performance: Ensure requirements meet performance baselines or initiate rebaseline if needed.
Critical Partners.Records Management: Ensure applicable records management standards are identified.

activities: Requirements elicitation during sessions with customers.
Business needs consolidated and affirmed; functional and data requirements connected.
Requirements Document (RD) established as a matrix to track module satisfaction.
Documentation from prior phases revised or updated as needed.
Procure Government Human Resources and Services.
Acquisition Strategy must support management decisions on procurement, funding, and MOUs/SLAs.
Perform technical analysis and evaluation of vendor proposals.
Enable Source Selection Official to make award decisions.
Continuously update Acquisition Strategy with Investment Manager and Contracting Officer involvement.
deliverables: Requirements Document with components (Final): Functional & Non-Functional Requirements, RTM, BPM Expansion, Logical Data Model.
The Requirements Document describes both project and product requirements, outlining technical, functional, and performance specifications.

exit_criteria.objective: To determine if the project requirements have been defined sufficiently to be translated into the Business Product.
phase_specific: The initial Test Plan is defined.
Requirements have been grouped and sufficiently detailed for testing once product is developed.
Process and Data Models are defined adequately for product design.
generic: Variances from baselines identified and mitigated (cost, schedule, and scope).
Project Baselines reviewed and revised as appropriate.

Project Management Plan and component plans updated, including: Risk Management, Acquisition Strategy, Change Management, Configuration Management, System Categorization, Requirements Management, Communication Plan, WBS/Schedule, IV&V Planning, Quality Assurance, Records Management, Staffing Management Plan.

project_review: The Requirements Review verifies that requirements are complete, accurate, consistent, traceable, and responsive to business needs.
Ensures suitability for design activities and confirms final agreement on Requirements Document content.
Upon successful completion, the Requirements Document is baselined.

stage_gate_review.title: Requirements Analysis Stage Gate Review
stage_gate_review.purpose: To consider whether the project should proceed to the Design Phase.
focus: Completion and approval of the Requirements Document.
Validation of alignment with business, cost, and performance baselines.
Confirmation of readiness to begin the Design Phase.
